attributes.action: Take down the government petition site.
attributes.background: Increasingly the government's petition site is being used for more & more frivolous purposes such votes of no confidence in individual ministers and efforts to reverse the result of the EU vote. These petitions are undemocratic in their nature and simply a means to complain having lost an election
attributes.additional_details:
EU Referendum petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/131215

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-eu-referendum-36634407

Examples of unnecessary "no confidence" petitions.

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/123469

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/111975

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/121152

attributes.action: Ban redoing referendums
attributes.background: We should not redo referendums

attributes.action: Make it so petition makers can represent their issue and argument in parliament.
attributes.background: Are you tired of an issue being raised through a petition, only for it to be raised in parliament and the issue not solved. I feel that we should have a chance to voice our issues and make our argument heard, not only through writing, but as people and actually get a resolution to the problem.

attributes.action: Hold a post referendum opinion poll on key factors before the exit negotiations.
attributes.background: Public opinion and information have been misrepresented in a highly complex question. Public opinion of key facts (Immigration, Economy, Politics, etc.) should be found before any exit negotiations can take place, to ensure accurate and fair representation of the true feelings of the population.
attributes.additional_details:
Evidence of misinterpretation of facts has been shown by those leading the campaigns. Public information and opinion has also been shown to be misinformed, given social media trends (i.e #Regretzit) and search engine results (i.e. What is the EU? / What are the results of leaving the EU?) taking place post the referendum result.

A full and open opinion poll should be carried out to find a better understanding of UK opinion on a wider number of topics involved in the exit debate.

attributes.action: Vote registration system to validate UK citizenship prior to issuing ballot card
attributes.background: Many people unelligable to vote because they are not UK citizens are illegally registering to vote in UK ballots because there are insufficient background checks on nationality. In particular this was highlighted in the EU referendum, where non-UK citizens were voting to remain.
attributes.additional_details:
Background checks on citizenship must be applied prior to registration acceptance to prevent electoral fraud. 

Where people do commit fraud in elections there needs to be a mechanism for criminal prosecution, rigorously followed through by the police and courts.

attributes.action: Consider independent representatives in all future referendum campaigns.
attributes.background: For all future referendum campaigns, we would like to see the appointment of independent and impartial representatives debate both sides of the argument (with the budget split evenly).  We feel that by doing this, each sides argument is based on fact and not for political gain.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition has been set up in the wake of the European referendum whereby both sides of the debate contained large degrees of scaremongering and, retrospectively it would appear a number of false statements.

We feel that the clear choice in a democratic society is for independent (non-political) representatives to debate both sides in future (based on facts) and with no bias.

attributes.action: Allow the alternative vote in the next General Election
attributes.background: With the current state of the country and the government in turmoil a General Election looks likely. We demand it incorporates the alternative vote system in order to encourage a fairer outcome for all political parties and allow voters to adequately portray their political views.

attributes.action: We must have a 2nd EU Referendum: Vote restricted to those aged 16 to 50 years.
attributes.background: The result of the first referendum is essentially a tie.  The result of the first referendum is made null and void by the deliberate misinformation and lies of both the Leave and Remain campaigns.  The first referendum failed to recognise that the primary stakeholders are the young and not the old.
attributes.additional_details: The political elite and the political media have entirely failed the British people. The 2nd referendum should only take place once a mechanism has been devised to moderate the arguments put forward by the Remain and Leave campaigns.  At the very least, arguments would require references which support the argument, in a similar way to academic papers being considered for publication in a journal.

attributes.action:
Reopen negotiations with EU to agree better terms for UK.
Hold 2nd referendum.
attributes.background:
The EU Referendum was based upon the last negotiations, which failed to satisfy the majority of voters.
Nevertheless, so momentous is the decision, the U.K. population deserve the opportunity to reconsider a further, more favourable, revision of our terms of membership in a 2nd referendum.

attributes.action: Start schools later
attributes.background: Make schools start and finish later so students can concentrate better

attributes.action: Increase funding to engage those 18-24 in the voting process
attributes.background: Turnout has fallen from over 60% in the early 1990s to an average of 40% and is estimated around 36% for Brexit. More funding is needed for neutral education on the system and process.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the British Election Study, the proportion of registered 18 to 24-year-olds turning out to vote has consistently been below every other age group since the 1970s.

Eurobarometer suggested that young British adults are among the least engaged with the political process when comparing their peers across Europe.

Young people do not only vote less, but research by the Electoral Commission suggests they are less likely to be on the electoral register than other age groups.

attributes.action: Take actions to eliminate bullying to teenage boys that enjoy Performing Arts.
attributes.background:
I'm a young boy and I really like dance - so much, that I would like to do it as a career. But unfortunately this isn't an easy thing to do - lots of homophobic bullying is involved. This shouldn't be tolerated. Boys and girls are equal - and so should be treated as so.
FACE THE FACTS, BOYS DANCE!

attributes.action: Over 60's should not be able to vote on our generations issues!
attributes.background: Anything from the EU vote to who becomes the new leader of the country are all decisions which will affect the current and young generation most. We are the ones who'll be living and dealing with the changes allot more. People who are older don't have to worry so much, our youth are your future!
attributes.additional_details: The youth are the future of the nation however the voices of the past get heard allot more! this has to stop.

attributes.action: Create basic check to ensure voters understand what they are voting about/on
attributes.background:
One of the benefits of being a British citizen is the right to vote, and to know that your vote has the power to influence laws, policies, taxes and more. 

It should be the duty of the government to British democracy to ensure and check that voters understand what they are voting on/about.
attributes.additional_details:
One example: an increase in the Google search term "What is the EU?" within the UK, the day after these searchers potentially voted on it. 
http://www.techinsider.io/what-is-the-eu-is-top-google-search-in-uk-after-brexit-2016-6

attributes.action:
-Extend EU exit interim period to 5years.
-Final Decision Referendum in Year 5.
attributes.background: The EU referendum was too close to be conclusive, and the future of the UK too uncertain to leave the EU in 2 years. We the undersigned request that the interim exit period be extended to 5 years with a Final Decision Referendum taking place in Year 5. We do not want this http://bit.ly/28TVrjb

attributes.action: Require a new referendum on EU with minimum 5% majority to be valid.
attributes.background: With new facts that have come to light, so many people voting based in mis-information and lack of detail, and the divided country we now live in, we want a new referendum on leaving the EU with a clear 5% majority. It's too an important decision to accept a 2% lead and a divided country.

attributes.action: Ban, for at least one year, petitions on the EU referendum.
attributes.background: Rerunning debates in Parliament that have been discussed ad nauseum takes up the valuable time of MPs. The country needs to settle after a protracted build up to the recent EU referendum. Forcing further debate in Parliament is negative.

attributes.action: Renegotiate a better deal with the EU before a 2nd referendum
attributes.background: The Government should return to the negotiating table with the EU to attempt to secure a better deal for the UK to remain, acceptable to the British public, which could then be offered to the British people in a 2nd referendum BEFORE Article 50 of the Lisbon treaty is invoked.
attributes.additional_details: David Cameron negotiated the deal with the EU from a position of weakness, by declaring beforehand that he wanted to remain. The referendum result has resulted in a general acceptance within the EU that change is needed. Now that it is clear to Europe that we WILL leave under the present conditions, we should offer the EU a 2nd referendum IF AND ONLY IF a more acceptable deal, addressing voters key concerns over immigration, can be offered to the British Electorate.

attributes.action: Parliament must not recess until there is a  ratified plan post-referendum
attributes.background: The electorate needs leadership and understanding. Parliament must sit until this is achieved. All facts and assertions must be independently verified and it must be a contempt of Parliament to knowingly supply, support or provide inaccurate or misleading information.
attributes.additional_details: The UK is in danger of disintegration. Leadership is needed.

attributes.action: Offer all pro-EU British citizens a grant to relocate to Europe.
attributes.background: Any current British citizen not wanting to live under UK governance should be offered a grant to relocate to an EU country. By doing so they forfeit forever all privileges afforded by the UK - such as free health care, pensions, disability benefits, social housing etc.

attributes.action: If MP's veto EU referendum result a General Election must be called.
attributes.background:
Some MP's from the Remain camp of the recent EU referendum, such as David Lammy, are suggesting that MP's should not vote through the result in parliament. 
If this is the case then all MP's should know that they are accountable to the public and a General Election be called immediately.
attributes.additional_details:
When the MP's are asked to vote whether to vote through the referendum result or not, then this should be a public ballot and not a secret ballot. 
This will ensure that the nation have the perfect opportunity to vote out, if they so wish, any MP's that have decided that democracy is only preferable when it is on their own terms.

attributes.action: Extend existing points immigration rules to non-Common Travel Area nationals
attributes.background: We petition parliament to extend the points based immigration system that applies to non-EU nationals to the citizens of countries outside the Common Travel Area, and make necessary adjustments to the points requirements to ensure an adequate supply of labour to the various sectors of the economy.
attributes.additional_details:
Common travel area: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/common-travel-area-cta/common-travel-area-cta

Immigration rules that apply to non-EU citizens: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/immigration-rules/immigration-rules-index

attributes.action: Make it law that a 2nd referendum cant be called for 20 years after the 1st.
attributes.background: To protect the democratic purpose of a refurendum a 2nd should not be held just because people disagree with the outcome. Having the law would mean people are fully aware of the consequences of voting in the first place. Its unfair for people to cast a vote then have to worry it could be overturned
attributes.additional_details: 2014 scottish independance from the UK referendum & 2016 UK membership of the EU referendum. These are two examples where calls for a 2nd referendum should be cancelled out by law, the decision has been made and should be respected.

attributes.action: Allow UK residents to vote in parliament elections and referendums.
attributes.background: After 5 years of continuous  residence people should be allowed to vote to have an influence on changes that will affect their lifes and residence in the  UK

attributes.action: Make UK election/referendum process compulsory in the national curriculum.
attributes.background: It is evident from many media reports after the recent EU referendum and following local/general elections, that a significant percentage of UK residents do not fully understand election/referendum processes. It reasonably follows that UK-wide education is required to remedy this.
attributes.additional_details: Too many references to mention in media of all natures including popularly watched/listened to television/radio channels and social media networks.

attributes.action: Every referendum must include a 'No Confidence in the Government' option
attributes.background: The Brexit vote was 52% leave 48% remain. A very small element of protest voting against the current government could have changed the result.

attributes.action: Co-ordinate a crowdfund of Tata Steel interests in the UK.
attributes.background: The UK is in danger of losing it's Steel industry due to the commercial viability for it's owners, Tata Steel. It is my petition that the UK government negotiate a scrap/asset disposal price from Tata, prepare a crowd-funding campaign for the acquisition and management of these assets.
attributes.additional_details: Furthermore, the crowdfunding campaign should look to raise sufficient additional funds to give a minimum 2 year safety net for the continuation of the business based upon projected revenue streams. For more information on how to support the campaign further please get your friends, employer and any wealthy individuals that you are connected with to visit myopinionpal.com where any funds raised will be used to get more people to support this petition.

attributes.action: Lower prescription charges
attributes.background:
Even being a full time employee, I find £8.20 a lot of money to have to find whilst I also have a family to support.
I understand that something should be paid but I dispute having to pay out all that especially when my health has gone down and have had to have 2 separate prescriptions in 2 weeks.
attributes.additional_details:
The government need to get the charges lowered as before long, prescription payers will rather stay sick then pay out all that money for an NHS prescription.
I also pay my national insurance and would rather pay a little more to have cheaper or free prescriptions as a UK tax payer.
Please join and sign the petition to ask to get the charges lowered or a new method as before long it will be over £10 for 1 item.

attributes.action: Make advertising in any form a fake job vacancy a serious offence
attributes.background: common practice within recruitment is to invent vacancies (even in some cases naming a real Company) to increase the number of CV's a recruitment agency has on file.  This completely wastes job-seekers time, effort, gives them false hope and distracts them from the real task of getting a job

attributes.action: Set a minimum standard for baby change and feed facilities in food outlets
attributes.background: Having seen my wife breastfeed our 3-month old daughter in numerous baby/parent facilities of varying hygiene and quality, I believe there should be a government-set minimum standard for dedicated rooms including all the following - baby change table, toilet, sink, paper towels and a feeding chair.
attributes.additional_details:
John Lewis and Fenwick's are companies setting high standards.  I have visited worse including M&S stores who combine baby facilities with a disabled toilet (no chair/poor hygiene) and Tesco (no toilet), whilst several Costa branches don't have anywhere private to sit so feeding has to be done standing up in the toilet.
As a father I see my wife feeding our baby in conditions that are poor and unhygienic for both parent/child, whilst I experience the lack of toilet facilities in changing areas.

attributes.action: 2017 to be the year that the UK start protecting native wildlife In our cities.
attributes.background: Our wildlife is losing it's natural habitat & struggling to adjust to our cities.In this unknown future in the UK due to Brexit.I ask you to firstly pledge your assurance to keep EU laws on our enviroment.Secondly, a guarantee that the goverment will help make our cities accessible to wildlife.
attributes.additional_details: This is important for our wildlife in the UK.In Milan over 800 trees have been planted on rooftops & balconies resulting in species abundance growth.This could be achieved in the UK with help from university students of Enviromental sciences.This cuts costs &helps students develop skills& portfolios,which could lead to job growth.If achieved,this could attract tourists to cities throughout the UK& boost our economy.There is no doubt that our wildlife,worldwide is depleting at a dangerous rate.

attributes.action: Divert 50% of the foreign aid budget to tackle social care for the aged in uk
attributes.background: More councils in the uk are short of funds to tackle social care in the UK.(12 billion foreign aid budget wasted on rogue nations/state officials), to go directly to councils, so that they do not in turn raise their taxes, which are currently too high now.
attributes.additional_details: This will help to pay for more care homes and after care for the elderly and release more beds in hospitals so that we can all benefit. With an ageing population, If this situation is not tackled this way, then bigger problems will arise. It is on best affordable way forward to this and still retains 50% of the foreign aid budget, which should be more scrutinised than currently is or scrapped altogether.

attributes.action: Introduce stricter laws & screening on people receiving benefits/social housing
attributes.background: Taxpayers contribute to the upkeep of social housing and benefits system. Many people on benefits abuse the system and many people living in council properties actually let the property out or do not look after / damage the property which then will have to be repaired and paid for by taxpayers.
attributes.additional_details: Experience in construction industry.

attributes.action: Raise the minimum wage for Under 25's to £7.50 in line with all other workers.
attributes.background: Young people can be paid considerably less for work than an adult, in the same role at the same company; U18's can be paid as little as £4.05 per hour & U21 £5.60; This pay gap is discriminatory legislation, which says YP are worth less than older citizens (Regardless of ability to perform the job.)
attributes.additional_details:
It's near impossible to live a decent quality of life on earnings around the minimum wage; So why for under 25's who work in the same roles as adults can be paid £3.45p/h less an hour despite being potentially better educated more capable than their adult counterparts. Many under 25's work their jobs to help low-income parents provide necessities and I feel this discriminatory legislation therefore unfairly targets the young people of low-income backgrounds who are just about managing to cover the costs of running a household...

I therefore petition the government for pay equity for under 25's.

attributes.action: Make the National Living Wage apply to people aged 21 or older not 25 or older.
attributes.background:
Adults in the workplace who are under 25 will be paid 45p less an hour than adults who are 25+ even if they do the exact same job.

A worker under 25 will be paid £810 less a year.
A working adult under 25 has the same bills as everyone else and should be paid the same.
attributes.additional_details: http://m.acas.org.uk/index.aspx?articleid=1902

attributes.action: Force negotiations between company bosses and unions to be made public
attributes.background:
In the run up to Christmas, unions have tactfully made yet another play for a pay rise using the holiday season as an opportunity to disrupt people's lives and demand better conditions.

Yet discussions at conciliatory services, such as ACAS, are rarely made public beyond their highlights
attributes.additional_details:
We request that negotiations, such as those taking place at ACAS be recorded and made public, so that we the people affect, often paying customers, have a clearer understanding. We believe unions and bosses alike will strongly endorse this measure as they have nothing to hide with regards to what their negotiating positions are.

Furthermore, it will give the public an opportunity to weigh in on what they think a fair deal is for staff at these organisations

attributes.action: Provide more help for young people trying to start up their own business.
attributes.background: Early stages of my teen life I was on the roads. However due to participating in some workshops provided by my local youth club it opened up doors for me. After a while I started looking at the big picture and saw my actual potential and decided to start up my own brand. We need more of this.
attributes.additional_details: Young people in today's generation are stereotyped to be thugs, thiefs & bad. These kids face a significant amount of gateways into that lifestyles, but where is the gateway to the successful lifestyle? We make it so easy for our kids to join the roads but so difficult to become a business person.

attributes.action: Introduce ecig workplace regulations to stop discrimination against vaping
attributes.background: Hundreds of workplaces are rightly, making policies to include ecigs. The trouble is that some policies are stating that vaping must be in smoking shelters. It is putting vapers at risk and forcing them off the premises to remain smoke free when the smokers have a shelter.
attributes.additional_details: Vaping is not smoking, therefore vapers should have their own rights and not be discriminated against or put at risk of passive smoking.

attributes.action: Ban the Broadcasting of Animal Abuse for Entertainment on Television
attributes.background: This petition calls for the government to place a ban on the broadcasting on television of animal abuse for the purposes of entertainment. It would not include other reasons - such as for charitable and educational purposes.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for individuals or businesses to own more than 3 houses.
attributes.background: I can understand having second, even third homes but the property market is out of control and will continue to be so given the economic environment we live in. The damage here is to social mobility, community, growing inequality and to people who are low-medium skilled.
attributes.additional_details:
I see no appropriate or logical reason to own multiple (I.e more than 3). There is no justifiable reason that I can see. 

Business will get around this so there will need to be incredibly tight restrictions on commercial properties and a rigorous approach to those looking to bypass the law.

attributes.action: Improve the treatment of asylum seekers and immigrants coming to the UK.
attributes.background: We believe that with help and support provided by the state asylum seekers and refugees can become just as much of as an asset to the UK. However, the treatment of these vulnerable individuals can only be changed through a shift in the Government's rhetoric and a change in British attitudes.
attributes.additional_details: Over the years the Government and the UK's attitudes towards asylum seekers and refugees have increasingly become more negative. The rhetoric that is pushed is one that pushes the idea of foreigners being somehow less valuable than those native to this country. We call on the Government to revisit and improve current policy.

attributes.action: The government to legislate that all Local Authorities Provide Public Toilets.
attributes.background: To many Local Authorities are closing Public Toilets,to try and save money caused by the governments cut backs. The people of the UK deserve to have the essential use of public toilets. Local Authorities need to be accountable for this Public Service.

attributes.action: Promote responsible drinking by enforced water stations in pubs, bars and clubs
attributes.background:
Significantly reduce incidents and Public Sectors costs, following other countries' lead by highlighting re-hydration in establishments with alcohol consumption. 
Eliminate queuing up and faux pas amongst peers by having water and electrolyte fluids available in prominent areas relative to capacity
attributes.additional_details:
Alcohol related incidents cost the public sector millions which can be significantly reduced by having easily identifiable water stations in all establishments. 

This can be done by having large containers or a simple bar tap facing the customer and also through encouragement of re-hydration electrolytes in between and after alcoholic drinks. 

NSW in Australia has a similar project already in place and the UK government should follow suit benefiting individuals and the greater community.

attributes.action: Make the use animal testing being advertised on product packaging a requirement.
attributes.background: We are petitioning for products to advertise their use or lack of cruelty-free testing as a requirement. This allows buyers to make an informed decision on products and their ethics.
attributes.additional_details: Over 3 million animals are tested on each year and many of these tests are unnecessary. The bulk of testing can be carried out digitally and therefore this cruelty to animals is unneeded.

attributes.action: Prioritise implementation of the alternative student finance product
attributes.background: Many Muslims are unable to attend university, because their faith prohibits them from taking interest based loans to fund tuition fees.The government has acknowledged this and have developed an alternative financing model.This needs to be made available so that more students can attend university
attributes.additional_details:
Links to previous developments;

2014 consultation
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/349899/bis-14-984-government-response-to-a-consultation-on-a-sharia-compliant-alternative-finance-product.pdf

White Paper 2016
Page 56- Alternative student finance offer
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/523546/bis-16-265-success-as-a-knowledge-economy-web.pdf

For information on developments visit
http://www.halalstudentloans.co.uk/

attributes.action: Increase Defence Spending to 2.5% of GDP.
attributes.background: NATO guidelines put 2% of GDP as the minimum defence spending for NATO countries. I point out the key word: MINIMUM. 2% is the bare minimum. It is not a "target". We must endeavour to bring our capabilities back up to adequate standards after careless, thoughtless cuts in the SDSR 2010 & 2015.
attributes.additional_details: It is a simple fact that when HMS Queen Elizabeth comes into service 13 Frigates and 6 Destroyers simply won't be adequate to form a Carrier Group whilst maintaining other global operations. We require AT LEAST 8 Type 26's, 12 T-31's and another 2 Destroyers. The RAF can only muster a pathetic 36 Jets whilst Saudi was deploying 100+ daily in Yemen. We call for immediate action to boost spending to 2.5% of GDP as to regain basic, minimum capability as quickly & efficiently as possible.

attributes.action: Grant legal rights of bodily liberty/integrity to apes, dolphins & elephants.
attributes.background: International scientific studies on genetics, intelligence, emotions and the social lives of these animals have proven to shown these animals are self-aware, autonomous beings.

attributes.action: Charge bus pass users 50p per single trip equating to £1 per return journey.
attributes.background: My husband and I are both pensioners but are not, by any means, "wealthy". Like most pensioners we appreciate a free bus pass but feel that a minimal charge each time we travel is not going to cause hardship. The money generated by this small charge could go towards desperate road repairs locally.

attributes.action: Increase the age to play the lottery from 16 to 18 the same as other gambling.
attributes.background: I have seen how gambling affects people. A 16 year old could buy a ticket and win millions. This could be dangerous, it could cause them to go off the rails.They could get in with the wrong crowd and be led into a life of drink and drugs.  This amount of money should be with adult supervision.
attributes.additional_details: You have to be 18 to gamble in this country, for example fruit machines, betting shops and casinos. Why is the lottery any different?

attributes.action: Make teaching 'Children's Rights' compulsory in all schools.
attributes.background: There are a list of more than 40 rights, which each child has. Most children don't even know these rights exist. Teaching children's rights in schools will inform all children of the rights they have.
